active_contexts.statement: Jan 27-28 FOMC: market pricing skewed to no-change (~88.5% per Polymarket snapshot).
active_contexts.market_link: Front-end (ZT/ZF) and equity duration (ES/NQ) are sensitive to data/speakers shifting near-term policy odds.
active_contexts.notes: Pricing proxy only; monitor catalysts that alter odds distribution.

active_contexts.statement: Fed calendar: Jan 28 FOMC decision 2:00pm ET; press conference 2:30pm ET.
active_contexts.market_link: Known timing concentrates intraday volatility around statement/presser across ES/NQ and the Treasury complex.
active_contexts.notes: Calendar item; impact depends on policy/SEP messaging at the meeting.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed SRF usage hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: Turn-of-year funding dynamics matter for front-end rates; focus is whether take-up normalizes post-turn.
active_contexts.notes: Reuters framed as calendar-driven rather than a stress signal.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed: standing overnight repo ops moved to full allotment with no aggregate operational limit (eff. Dec 11).
active_contexts.market_link: Structural tool-setting that can cap tail repo spikes; becomes relevant when funding-stress headlines hit.
active_contexts.notes: Operational detail; usually low day-to-day impact absent stress.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export demand a key drag (Reuters).
active_contexts.market_link: EU growth softness can pressure risk tone and support UST duration; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).
active_contexts.notes: Final prints; transmission mostly via broad risk sentiment.

watchlist.statement: US cash close (Jan 2): MOC buy imbalance S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M.
watchlist.market_link: Large closing imbalances can drive late-day futures dislocations and raise next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

watchlist.statement: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% (Nov) vs 2.8% (Oct); slow-moving liquidity signal.
watchlist.market_link: Secondary input for EUR rates/FX; matters for US futures mainly via EU risk/ECB repricing headlines.
watchlist.notes: Background unless paired with larger EU macro surprises.

watchlist.statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; no revision vs prior/forecast.
watchlist.market_link: Final print tends to be lower impact than ISM; attention usually on prices/new orders details vs an unchanged headline.

watchlist.statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 vs flash 51.2; marginal expansion but softer than first read.
watchlist.market_link: UK/Europe growth tone can influence broad risk sentiment; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Reaction-function framing can shift front-end pricing and spill into equity duration sensitivity (ES/NQ) and USD (DX).

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Follow-up remarks can clarify inflation vs growth balance and conditions for the next policy move.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Meeting (Decision/Statement; press conference 2:30pm ET)
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Scheduled policy decision; reprices front-end expectations and transmits to equities and USD via real-rate moves.

headline_memory.headline: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 (year-end).
headline_memory.why_it_matters: Calendar-driven funding tightness context; watch normalization for front-end/liquidity tone.

headline_memory.headline: Germany Dec manufacturing PMI final 47.0; contraction deepened with export sales a key drag (Reuters).
headline_memory.why_it_matters: EU growth weakness can weigh risk tone and support duration bids during risk-off episodes.

change_log.reason: Added official Fed calendar timing for Jan 2026 FOMC (2:00pm statement; 2:30pm presser) to anchor event-volatility windows.
Reconfirmed record $74.6B Dec 31 take-up and calendar-driven framing via Reuters; kept short TTL into early post-turn period.
Verified NY Fed statement and Fed implementation note describing full-allotment/no aggregate limit effective Dec 11, 2025.
Revalidated Eurozone final 48.8 and Germany final 47.0 with export drag via Reuters Jan 2 coverage.
